intro: Mesembryanthemum olivaceum, commonly known as the olive sandmat, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, which is characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the morning and close in the afternoon. Its leaves are fleshy and often covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. It is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
